definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: Then over time you will not be able to have a bowel movement without using them.
sentences.chinese: 那么你会在一段时间内都无法使用大解。

sentences.english: He came to the sheep pens along the way; a cave was there, and Saul went in to relieve himself.
sentences.chinese: 到了路旁的羊圈，在那里有洞，扫罗进去大解。

sentences.english: If you only have one bowel movement per week, then most definitely you have chronic constipation.
sentences.chinese: 如果你每周只有一个大解，那么你绝对多数慢性便秘。

sentences.english: Da Xie is a contemporary Chinese poet, with considerable influence around the whole country.
sentences.chinese: 大解是中国当代诗坛中生代诗人，在全国较有影响。

definition: to defecate (euphemism)/to go to the toilet
to relieve oneself (i.e. use the toilet)/to solve
to pee pee (kiddie or feminine slang)
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to leave uncultivated for a long time/by extension, to neglect one's work/to remain single
